data.title: Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes
data.text:
Plan your visit

Free admission.

How to Get Here

Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes

Av. del Libertador 1473

Ciudad Aut√≥noma de Buenos Aires, Argentina

+54 (011) 5288-9900

[email protected]

Means of public transport

Buses: 17, 61, 62, 67, 92, 93, 110, 124 y 130.

Underground: H Line, Facultad de Derecho station.

Opening hours

Tuesday to Friday, 11 am to 7.30 pm; Saturday and Sunday, 10 am to 7.30 pm.

Monday: closed.

The Museum is closed on January 1, May 1, June 27, and December 24, 25, and 31, 2024.

Museum Shop

Tuesday to Friday, 11 am to 7.30 pm; Saturday and Sunday, 10 am to 7.30 pm.

Monday: closed.

Contact: +54 11 4803-4062 int 218 / [email protected]

Library

Tuesday to Friday, 11 am to 5 pm. Saturday, 10.30 am to 3.30 pm.

Schedule your visit by mail: [email protected].

Check the catalog online.

Information and Services

Access to exhibition spaces

The Baggage Check service is available. The Museum recommends visiting the rooms with small bags.

Small purses and backpacks are allowed in the rooms. If you enter with backpacks, they must be placed on the chest to avoid causing inconvenience with the rest of the visitors or friction with the works.

It is not allowed to enter the rooms with packages or accessories that, according to the Museum staff opinion, may represent a potential danger to the works and visitors (such as tripods or extendable arms for cell phones and/or cameras).

It is not allowed to enter with animals (except for assistance or guide dogs), food, drinks or plants.

The Museum has an Automatic External Defibrillator and personnel trained to use it. The device was provided by the VITTAL Foundation.

Accessibility

The Museum is accessible for people with reduced mobility in all its rooms and floors, and has adapted services on the ground floor, the second story and the Pavilion for temporary exhibitions.

It has an elevator (door opening: 70 cm) to access all floors.

Wheelchairs are available at the Information area.

Accessible bathrooms.

Guide dogs, welcome! (Law No. 26,858/2013).

Within the Argentine Tourism Quality System, the National Museum of Fine Arts was distinguished in Accessibility Guidelines in 2018. The seal was revalidated in 2023 for the next three years.
